intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. angustibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bract psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
